    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor​(boolean isPlayer,
             java.lang.String nameReference,
             int xpos,
             int ypos)
        This constructor should be used for the player and the player alone. Creating more than one player may lead to issues.
        Parameters:
        isPlayer - Used to specify this contructor and ensure that an incorrect NPC isn't made into a player.
        nameReference - name reference, if the player's given a unique name.
        xpos - Starting x position
        ypos - Starting y position

      • Actor

        public Actor​(java.lang.String name,
             int x,
             int y)
        Constructor for dirt, or other pushable entities. They have the same speed as the player.
        Parameters:
        name -
        x -
        y -

      • Actor

        public Actor​(java.lang.String name,
             int x,
             int y,
             java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> path)
        Constructor for a hostile mob - likely the "spider". Includes a list of coordinates which is it's patrol path.
        Parameters:
        name -
        x -
        y -
        path -

    • Method Detail

      • isAtEndOfSegment

        public boolean isAtEndOfSegment()
        Returns true if the actor is at the end of a given patrol segment, false if not.
        Returns:

      • advanceSegment

        public void advanceSegment()
        Advances the patrol segment to the next one in line, dependant on whether or not the actor's going clockwise or anticlockwise. To be used in conjunction with isAtEndOfSegment

      • reverseMovementDirection

        public void reverseMovementDirection()
        Flip the movement from clockwise to anticlockwise or vise-versa

      • getNextMove

        public Direction getNextMove()

      • getIsMoving

        public boolean getIsMoving()

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Advances the actor's movement by one "tick". If it's completed a movement cycle, then it changes coordinates accordingly.

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith​(Actor o)
        Compares two actors and returns true if they both share the same coordinates (IE, if they collide)
        Parameters:
        o - The second actor to compare with this one
        Returns:
        True if the actors collide, false otherwise

      • getX

        public int getX()

      • getY

        public int getY()

      • getspeed

        public int getspeed()

      • move

        public void move​(Direction dir)

      • fillInMode

        public void fillInMode()
        The "fill in" mode, where this actor effectively becomes uninteractable with. Originally this would have been where it turned into a tile. However, to ensure that the "gaps" or "water" end up rendered properly, this happens instead. THIS INTERACTS WITH NOTHING OUTSIDE OF THE DIRT BLOCK. WATER BLOCK MUST BE CHANGED SEPERATELY WITH NULLIFY! Also make sure to check that the water hasn't already been "nullified"

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()

      • getName
